snippet: Finding rigs can be a challenge for oil companies operating in Cuba because the machinery must have less than 10 percent of its parts manufactured in the United States.
abstract: Russian oil company Zarubezhneft will delay drilling its first exploratory well off Cuba, after apparently struggling to find a rig that would not violate a United States embargo; finding rigs can be a challenge for oil companies operating in Cuba because the machinery must have less than 10 percent of its parts manufactured in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Finding rigs can be a challenge for oil companies operating in Cuba because the machinery must have less than 10 percent of its parts manufactured in the United States.

headline.seo: Decades-Old U.S. Embargo Delays Foreign Drilling Off Cuba’s Coast
headline.main: Russian Oil Drilling Off Cuba Is Delayed by Old Embargo
headline.print_headline: Russian Oil Drilling Off Cuba Is Delayed by Old Embargo
